ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: Simi Bhat
Simi Bhat
Simi
Simi Bhatt
Simi Bhat
Simi Bhat

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: This was a really high-workload, client-oriented course. If the clients are great, the course is enjoyable...if the clients are difficult (as mine were), the course is very difficult. However, I still learned an enormous amount about both the issue area that I researched and about working with clients. I may have learned more lessons about working with clients as a result of having difficult, demanding ones! That being said, the course was high-stress and high-work, especially towards the end of the semester, and crowded out some of my other obligations.

The best things about this course included the experimental and hands-on learning of the clinic, the guest speakers, and the field trip to the Natural Resources Defense Council in NYC. I enjoyed my clinic working group, all of whom were very dedicated, intelligent and responsible teammates. I learned first-hand how to conduct legal research and legal writing. I was grateful for the importance of the project we were given and how our work will actually benefit our clients and their environmental advocacy.
Learn practical skill to work with clients
Great opportunity to work on real, timely issues.
flexibility, choices, actually working with organizations
The instuctor has a nice casual conversation style of presenting the material. Professor Elliot is a very intesting person to listen to in class, and probalby out of class too.
The project was extremely interesting. And the working group was also great.
Learning about working with demanding legal clients.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: A TA would have been good to have in the class for some logistical support. There were some house keeping items which were in limbo. There was some switching of the sylabus, I had to figure out the Inside YLS site myself, and also the web exam procedure.I realize it is the classic law school format, but I don't think having the entire grade based on a final exam makes me learn as much as classes with multiple exams and class papers.

The lectures/speakers. I did not find them particularly useful, because they did not appeal to all students. Also the moot court exercise should be done at the begining when students can spend more time preparing. Otherwise the exercise is not taken seriously because there is too much work going on.
Learning about working with demanding legal clients. More explicit teaching on how to handle consultant-client relations and problems would have been MUCH appreciated.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Simi Bhat, the TA, was extremely helpful. She definitely helped to lead the clinic through the entire process, particularly making sure we were up to date on what to expect each week. She also took extra time to meet with my clinic group a couple of times to make sure we were clarifying tasks with our clients and to give a 2-hour workshop on how to conduct legal research.
Instructor and TA were both available most of the time.
I never contacted the professor.
it was excellent

Great. We met in project teams with one or both of the profs every other week, and the TA was super-available, including spending an entire morning providing my FES-heavy team with a crash course on legal citations.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: This was a very important and valuable course for my academic program here at Yale FES, especially given my interest in applying to law school. I have had a number of policy related courses and a couple of law classes, but this was my very first clinical course which gave me a greater understanding and appreciation for environmental law and advocacy.
It gives me a backgroud to environmental law and complements my studies.
For someone interested in environmental policy it was great. Not only are you working on current issues, but you get practical experience from working with clients as well as working with groups.
You look at environmental policy issues from a legal perspective...a very good angle to add to your policy toolkit.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I took this course because I wanted to take advantage of the opportunities available to me while at FES. Despite expecting a challenge, I chose to participate in this clinic in order to learn and gain the best experiences I can during my time at FES. I also took this course because I am interested in hands-on environmental advocacy and I am also planning to pursue a law degree after FES.
To obtain knowledge of how environmental law works.
Interested in the project and practical experience
I heard great things about it from past years and enjoyed working in client-based courses before.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes
yes
Yes it did.
Yes.
Yes.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes, very
Yes
Yes
No. I got completely different things--I did not expect to spend so much time and effort on learning to write legal memos, use legal citation style, or negotiate expectations with clients.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: There are always advantages and disadvantages of group work- having an opportunity to anonymously assess the contribution of all members at the end of a group project may ensure ongoing equitable engagement of all members in a project.
advantages: creativity, work load sharing
the advantages were that we were all very interested in the subject and had something to add. There was good synergy among group members. We also were disciplined.
It was the bulk of the course. Our group was great--equally dedicated, patient, good communicators. There was no way we could have tackled the scope of our project on an individual basis.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Pay attentions to the nuances of the cases. Try to figure out how the case fits into the big picture of environmental law, and it's importance in the context.
choose a project that you are interested. Also make sure that you take notes when talking to clients and resend them to them.

Try to get a good client! And come to the profs/TAs early and often with issues--they were very good at helping us resolve difficulties in our client relationships, even helping us moderate a phone call in which we hashed out and clarified issues.
